alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 21 at 3:34PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, Central and Western Los Angeles and much of Ventura. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 PM PST, scattered to numerous showers have been detected by radar. Areas of moderate to locally heavy rain have been occurring throughout the day, and additional activity is expected through at least the early overnight hours. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area, and isolated rock and mud slides have also been reported. Similar impacts will likely continue through at least 1AM PST Friday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Malibu, Acton, Ojai, Chatsworth, Agoura Hills, Woodland Hills, Northridge, Santa Clarita, Encino, Van Nuys, North Hollywood, Burbank and Griffith Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
